title: Amanda Holden reveals her confident display of 't*ts and teeth' hides her anxiety
text:
She's the bubbly and outgoing judge on Britain's Got Talent, having thrilled fans in the role for over twelve years with her witty remarks and racy outfits.

But Amanda Holden has revealed she wakes up every day with 'exam tummy' yet hides her insecurities by making it work with t**ts and teeth'.

Despite her successful TV and radio career, the star, 48, told how she still faces a daily battle with anxiety, with her self-assured display being her 'armour'.

Candid: Amanda Holden has revealed she wakes up every day with 'exam tummy' yet covers up her insecurities by 'making it work with t**ts and teeth'

Opening up to The Sun , Amanda explained: 'I wake up every morning with something I call "exam tummy". Everyone else calls it anxiety. Although anxiety is a very important subject, it's not one I'm going to jump on.'

The star went on to detail the way in which she overcomes her internal struggle, claiming that a dazzling smile and polished appearance goes a long way.

'You just make it work. T*ts and teeth!' she shared. 'If I had that in Latin, I’d put it across my door as my motto. I hate walking into rooms on my own. I count my footsteps walking down the street. I constantly take a deep breath.'

She continued: 'You just talk yourself down. You tell yourself you’ve got nothing to worry about and you go out and face the world. I will always wear my eyelashes. I will always be well presented. That’s my armour.'

Internal struggle: Despite her successful TV and radio career, the star, 48, told how still faces a daily battle with what she calls 'exam tummy' , with her self-assured display being her 'armour'

The TV personality also discussed her past traumas, which included a stillbirth and a miscarriage, and told how she won't let 'dark moments' in her life 'define' her.

She added that anxiety is one of life's 'normal feelings', explaining that you have to 'understand one to understand the other.'

Reflecting on the heartbreaking moments in her life, the brave star added you have to 'understand one to understand the other' and be 'anxious' to be 'calm' so she gets on with her life and is always 'well-presented.'

Adding she was besieged by insecurities, the star detailed that she wakes up most mornings with butterflies and a feeling of apprehension but makes the decision to get on with it

And while Amanda can turn to her record producer husband Chris Hughes in her times of need, the one person she can really rely on to lift her spirits id former NGT co-star Piers Morgan.

The star revealed that the Good Morning Britain host is the 'best' person to put 'everything into perspective', with Piers making her believe that she face anything.

Speaking her truth: 'I wake up every morning with something I call "exam tummy". Everyone else calls it anxiety'

Brave face: 'You just make it work. T*ts and teeth!' she shared. 'If I had that in Latin, I’d put it across my door as my motto'

Meanwhile, with reports that she, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams have been signed up for another series of BGT, Amanda told how she 'never expects' to keep her job as boss Simon Cowell is the 'king of change'.

She adds that the music mogul recognises that the public love the panel, so it would be 'dangerous to break it.'

Elsewhere, Amanda recently claimed her daughters, Lexie, 13, and Hollie, seven, 'were thrilled' she scooped the Rear of the Year accolade earlier this year as she branded the prize 'the BAFTA of the bottom world' in a cheeky interview Good Morning Britain last month.

The TV and radio personality appeared on the breakfast show alongside Heart FM co-presenter Jamie Theakston, 48, via video call and was quizzed by host and her pal Piers, 54, on having the best bum in showbusiness.

Opening up: 'I will always wear my eyelashes. I will always be well presented. That’s my armour'

Congratulating Amanda, who he used to work alongside as a judge on Britain's Got Talent, Piers exclaimed: 'You were voted Rear Of The year!'

Piers' co-host Susanna Reid, 48, then interjected: 'Has that ever been awarded to a man?'

Excited by her win, Amanda shared: 'That caused uproar! My girls were thrilled!'

Piers joked: 'I think you worked very hard for that award!'

Amanda then giggled: 'That was like a BAFTA in the bottom world!'

Seemingly delighted for his former colleague, Piers added: 'A week doesn't go past without seeing your delightful posterior on the social media airwaves!'
description: Amanda Holden has revealed she wakes up every day with 'exam tummy' yet hides her insecurities by making it work with t**ts and teeth'.
